sanskrit_verse:
दक्षिणेन मृतं शूद्रं पुरद्वारेण निर्हरेत् ।
पश्चिमौत्तरपूर्वैस्तु यथायोगं द्विजन्मनः ॥ ५.९२॥
transliteration:
dakṣiṇena mṛtaṃ śūdraṃ puradvāreṇa nirhare t |
paścimottarapūrvai stu yathāyogaṃ dvijanmanaḥ || 5.92 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: A deceased Śūdra shall be removed from the city through the southern gate; a twice-born individual shall be taken out through the west, north, and east gates respectively according to their yogic capacity.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from ontological status, not social role
Causation aligns with directional consciousness-energy dynamics
Capacity-based responsibility reflects spiritual embodiment levels
Restoration logic requires alignment with cosmic directional dharma
Consciousness alignment mandates body disposal congruent with birth-state vibration
executable_legal_axioms: IF subject.birth_status = 'Śūdra' AND death_occurred THEN disposal_direction := 'south'
IF subject.birth_status IN {'Brāhmaṇa', 'Kṣatriya', 'Vaiśya'} AND death_occurred THEN disposal_direction := SELECT FROM ['west','north','east'] BY yogic_capacity DESCENDING
IF disposal_direction NOT ALIGNED WITH birth_vibration THEN INITIATE consciousness_recalibration_protocol()
